benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/tags - Add tags to bundle

covered: Valid Payload: Many scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC07) exercise successful creation with valid payloads across different headers and body shapes.
Bad/Malformed Payloads: Tests TC10 (malformed JSON), TC11 (non-array body), TC12 (invalid tag UUIDs), TC15 (extra fields) cover input validation and error handling for invalid payloads.
Boundary Conditions: TC07 (empty array) tests boundary of payload; TC20 (max payload size) and TC21 (payload too large) cover payload size limits.
Duplicate Handling: TC26 covers regression for duplicate tags and ensures no duplicates in response.
Authorization/Authentication: TC16 covers unauthorized access (401) scenarios; TC04/TC01 show proper operation with authorization headers.
Service/Backend Failures: TC17 (503 service unavailable) and TC22 (slow backend) address resilience under backend issues.
Integration: TC27 and TC28 verify integration with GET and cross-service data consistency, ensuring end-to-end coverage.

Special/Edge Cases: TC08 (invalid bundleId format), TC09 (non-existent bundleId), TC14 (missing request body), TC19 (transient network retry), TC23 (extra unsupported HTTP headers) cover a range of edge cases.
gaps: Authorization coverage could be expanded to differentiate 401 vs 403 (present 401 in TC16, but additional forbidden cases are not explicit).
Rate Limiting: No tests specifically address rate limiting or throttling of rapid consecutive requests.
Caching Behavior: No tests validate caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or cache invalidation behavior for POST responses.

Pagination is not applicable for POST to a single bundle, but there is no explicit note on how large result sets would be paged if the API returns a list in certain responses; this is not relevant for POST creation but could be mentioned for completeness in a broader API guideline.
Server Error Coverage: While 503 is tested, there is no explicit 500 Internal Server Error scenario for database or internal service failures (only 503).
Performance/Test Coverage: While TC24 and TC25 address performance under load, more explicit, measurable response time targets beyond “within thresholds” could be added for consistency.
recommendations: Add explicit 403 Forbidden scenarios to ensure proper handling when user lacks necessary permissions.
Introduce rate-limiting/throttling tests to verify behavior under rapid consecutive POSTs (e.g., 429 or appropriate backoff).
Add tests validating caching headers on POST responses where applicable (ETag/Cache-Control) and ensure proper cache invalidation semantics if the API returns created resources.
Add an explicit 500 Internal Server Error scenario to cover unexpected backend/database failures beyond 503 (e.g., simulated DB outage leading to 500).
Clarify and expand performance testing with concrete target metrics (e.g., max response time under load, percentile-based timings) and document acceptable variance.
